column5: I am a firefighter in omemee asking people to watch were you are going please. last night about 130 am i got a call for two people that went through the ice by the train bridge in omemee. this is a river that is open and the people thought that it was froven, yamaha enticers do not skip water very well and there trip to omemee got really cold. So just no your water and ride your sleds safe The people were sent to hospital for precautions but will be fine other then the recovery bill the police gave him (beats a DUI i guess lol)
Snowmobiling on ice in the dark is one of the most stupid things you can do!  Those people are damn lucky to be alive!!!

hey GCD "canadians stay canadian, americans stay american. canadians know how she be."  in all seriousness, ya..... that is a very stupid thing to do!  i'd only do that during the day when i can see alot better  give me a sled with a good 1 1/2-2" paddle and it'll be all good.
What's even stupider Glen.. there' no ice there....
Evidently they thought ice was there...  ... yanno what thought did don'cha?... and that's what happens to all snowmobilers that go through the ice... they thought it was safe.
Oh  I always thought thats why Snowmobiles came equipped with '' Headlights ''
The headlight is for dry land... not the ice, watch the vid Paul!
You just gotta know where you are going

you can see open water at night. its all white then BLACK, stay away from the darkness, or get on that throttle always fun doing an evening ride down the goulais river, did 30 miles of the river last week one evening. and sleds are pretty good on the water.
guess old enitcers are not good on water my zl 700 does water like a champ
hahaha they arent good on snow either!
